metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40647 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In man2html 1.6g, a specific string being read in from a file will overwrite the size parameter in the top chunk of the heap. This at least causes the program to segmentation abort if the heap size parameter isn't aligned correctly. In version before GLIBC version 2.29 and aligned correctly, it allows arbitrary write anywhere in the programs memory.

criterions.comment: man2html: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
